user_review: Stayed in town for Nuit Blanche and checked out this lovely restaurant in Old Montreal because it was highly reviewed. The service was great - my server was very attentive and checked in often. I was only there to try the Beef Tartar but she also made great recommendations.To start the escargot was delicious, good portion and yummy red pepper sauce. The Beef Tartar was my reason for visiting and I was not disappointed. Great portion but I did have to ask for more bread. Still feeling a bit hungry, I ordered the Warm Goat Cheese - nicely plated, very smooth and also came with a side salad. Great value will definitely look to come back in the summer to enjoy the patio. Worthwhile checking out if you're looking for good eats on a budget.

If you're looking for hearty, unpretentious French food, stop here. You'll be fully satisfied with their fare.  We went for the lamb shank with mashed potatoes and the hangar steak with potatoes, mushroom and arugula salad and of course, for desert, a large portion of creme brulee. We went on a weekday night and it was quiet (this was pre-covid) and were seated at a cosy booth on the ground floor. We pretty much had the place to ourselves and enjoyed the romantic ambiance.  Great place for comfort French food!

Visited this cute little place when I was in Canada and definitely one of my top restaurants to revisit when I'm back in Montreal!My boyfriend and I wanted to try some French food while we were in Canada since it only seemed appropriate and boy oh boy was it so worthwhile. We made a reservation for the place but had arrived a bit early and the waiters were so kind to accommodate us since there weren't many people. Our waiter was very kind and patient with us since we had explained it was our first time there. He even took the time to recommend me 2 choices of wine to pair with my entree and you could tell he really wanted us to enjoy our dinner!The food: We ordered the French Onion Soup which  honestly I hate onions, I KNOW... BUT the flavor of the soup was so undeniably delicious. I did avoid the onions luckily enough my boyfriend enjoys them HAHA. For my entree, I ordered the Lamb shank which was 100x LEGIT FIRE! It came paired with carrots and mashed potatoes which was a match made in heaven for my lamb hands down. My boyfriend ordered the Duck Confit which was also SOO tasty and he did enjoy very much and was well seasoned too! We also took advantage of the Yelp Check-In offer which was a choice of dessert and we went with the Creme Brûlée which was the cherry on top of our lovely dinner! Definitely a 5/5 rating!

So this place came up as highly ranked among the best in Montreal so I made it a goal to eat here while on business. Here's how it went!Atmosphere/Appearance: Once parking on the street and turning the corner to see this beautiful, open courtyard lined with tables and chairs we were excited to have a seat to experience the real French style of dining outdoors! The cute restaurant is elongated with red paint for the top 2 floors and a bright yellow for the bottom. I couldn't tell you much of what the interior looked like since we were outside, but I can tell you that you walk right by the open kitchen where you can see the chefs work their magic as you make your way to the bathroom. I loved the way this place is setup and we were very thankful for the great weather.Service: Anne was taking great care of us while training a brand new young lady who was having her first day while we were there! I think her name started with a "C", but no matter, they were both awesome and paid a great deal of attention to us. I hope the new girl is doing well!Food: So... they had an appetizer special of the day, frog legs. I had never had them before in my life and have heard the "they taste like chicken" thing way too many times so it was time to settle this! I ordered them and they were actually delicious. They're quite fatty, but flavorful. There isn't much mean on the bones, you know... it's a frog, but it was good and it did resemble chicken. For my entree I went with the Braised Lamb Shank. It consists of the shank, mashed potatoes, roasted carrots, then drizzled with homemade BBQ Sauce all inside a cast iron "tub". It was FABULOUS. The meat fell off the bone of course and was so freaking tasty. I was very happy with my meal.Value: This place isn't cheap. In my travels I've found that many French-based restaurants aren't cheap at all. Lol. All prices are in CAD$. My appetizer was a special so it surprisingly only $12.00. Imagine that. Lol. However, my lamb shank was $27.00. Totally worth the money.In conclusion, I loved this place and truly felt like I COULD HAVE had this very same experience in France. One day I'll get there and can confirm this! Lol. Check this place out if you can.

A lovely atmosphere and a fine place to eat.  We sat outside during the summer near the fountain and the walk way.  Towards the end of dinner, a band came and started playing some songs.  The entire experience made everything feel very European.My husband ordered the duck confit and I had the poached cod.  The presentation of the food was excellent and the dishes were very balanced.  The duck confit was roasted to a crisp and given a side salad. The arugula gave a nice kick to the dish while the vinaigrette added a hint of acidity.The poached cod was cooked through and did not have much flavor on its own.  But with the nuts and veggie mix on top, it had a wonderful full taste when everything was added together.  The only issue I had was that they forgot to make Salmon Tartare until reminded.  We ordered the frog legs and Salmon Tartare as appetizers.  Unfortunately, we only got one and finished the legs before needing to gently remind the waiter about our other dish.  It was not a big deal and we continued to have a nice meal afterwards.

Dining inside on a warm evening with the front open was a great way to start a stay in Montreal, especially with friends who wanted a meal representative of the French cuisine in Montreal. The wine list is impressive, but among us we imbibed little, just one glass and a few cocktails. The rest of the "oohs," "aahs" and "yums!" were for all the cuisine. This included everything, from the crusty bread to the soups (the French Onion Soup is classic), and the entrees. I have a rule in restaurants: "If they have lamb on the menu, you order lamb, unless they also offer duck."  Duck breast it was, accompanied by very well prepared vegetables, including some of the tastiest cooked carrots I've ever had (I hate cooked carrots unless they're roasted!). Service was great, especially since they were performing Tetris-like activities trying to get our meals onto small round tables. Bonus points for the rest room sign. I didn't take a photo - you'll just have to go there to see it, and order some food and drink while you're there too.

Came here with 3 friends with a reservation we made an hour in advance. We ran into another friend when we were here so that was pretty funny! Food: DEFINITELY remember to check in! Can't waste a good free dessert! We got the cream puff dessert, pretty sure it varies depending on what they have available. The free bread is quite fluffy and crunchy! I got the seasonal risotto which was quite bland if I may say so but with the help of my friend's duck confit and pan fried steak the dish tasted a lot better. We also tried the Foie gras which wasn't like great but tasted authentic nonetheless. Service: Service was actually kind of slow but the waiter was really nice and gave us refills of bread.Ambiance: it's a classy date night vibe and I loved the decorations! This was a nice intro to Montreal! I wouldn't come back but I appreciated the experience.

I went here last night and had such a wonderful experience! Not only was the service and food great, but sitting in their outdoor seating area was the perfect setting for a rare date night. My fiancé and I are not ones to go out for a nice meal so when we chose to go here last night we had high hopes and were so happy with our choice. We started with the warm goat cheese salad because of the pictures of a fellow Yelper. While the goat cheese was absolutely amazing, the salad greens were completely saturated and almost soggy with dressing. Our salad also did not look anything like the picture posted on Yelp. As an update, the menu changes seasonally, so do not count on the menu being the same as the one shown on Yelp. I was very excited to get the chicken shown on the menu on Yelp, since I don't eat red meat, but they did not have any chicken entrees when I visited. They had multiple red meat entrees and a cod dish, which I tried and was very good - but not perfect. We also tried the dessert special with roasted apricots and mint-thyme ice cream, it was incredible!

On a recent girls trip we stumbled upon this restaurant right next to our apartment and it was great. The restaurant was cute and cozy with typical French fair. We got the escargot, frogs legs and French onion soup as starters. The French onion soup was perfect for the chilly day and great flavor. I had the steak which was cooked to my liking and full of the flavor. The creme brûlée was delicious. If you are looking for yummy French food check this place out!

The pedestrian-only rue Prince Arthur is lined with many good restaurants; Le Deux Gamins is one of the best. It is a warm, cozy restaurant with excellent service and food. The server well explained all the menu choices. I had onion soup and duck confit. The duck confit was excellent with moist meat and crispy skin.

French fare. Like GENUINE french fare! Escargot specials, classic french onion soup, and an expectation of bottled wine ordering at every table... a bit cramped, but with the terra cotta walls, arched wooden-framed window details, and candle lit tables, this place is the epitome of  romance. Use the yelp check in feature for a free dessert tasting. They chose cream puffs in a raspberry and chocolate sauce for me

Really enjoyed the meal we had here. The service was awesome. Had the hanger steak and tried the French onion soup. French onion soup was awesome, so filling, flavourful and full of onions and cheese. The steak was also delicious. Shared the charcuterie board. The pickles were the most surprising. It was so good!

An underwhelming experience overall. Both the service and food was disappointing. Service: The dining area isn't particularly huge. We were seated on the main floor and the servers could easily view all the tables in the area. However, we felt neglected. The servers were mostly with the larger tables and we felt like he didn't care to offer service to my table. Food:The food was okay. I didn't think the food was worth the price. The portions were small and the flavors were underwhelming. The most disappointing dish was the escargots. The portion was tiny and I didn't enjoy how they fried the escargots. Overall:This place is overhyped and I do not recommend it.

If you're looking to feel quintessentially français in Montreal, Les Deux Gamins offers up a slightly cozy, slightly high end experience. French onion soup, foie gras, beef tartare...all those things that a Francophile foodie would fall head over heels for. It was a nice but blistering August evening and a group of friends and I arrived here on our last day in Montreal to really get a taste of the French side of things. We got treated to a view of the street, what was basically, two open garage doors on the second storey. It was hot, apparently people in Montreal don't believe in AC. I have no idea how the cooks survive, but walking past their open kitchen, they looked like they were moving quick and enjoying work. Now I'm not a French food connoisseur but I can tell when something tastes good. And yep. The food here tasted pretty good. The French onion soup was cheesy, not too salty, and very satisfying. It was perfect to share between two people, or if you feel like only having a soup for a meal. The beef tartare was fresh and tasty, with a beautiful egg yolk on top.The duck is one of their signatures, I believe. At least people had good things to say about it in reviews. I actually found it the most unimpressive out of what we tried though. The duck confit wasn't memorable and while I don't hate peas, I thought the pea puree was a little too abundant and a little too sweet. Service was lovely and friendly. There were barely any patrons in the building with us, and maybe just a handful sitting outside. Not that we minded, it was actually quite a nice quiet evening...until a very loud family with young kids was placed next to us and the parents decided it was ok for them to run around and knock glasses over...sigh.(67/100) - 2018

Be who you are, that's what I say.Are you a French restaurant? Yes you are. Are you a little bit touristy? Maybe. But that's a little bit of your charm, I think. You don't have a bright red exterior and lots of advertising on the outside of your restaurant if you're not, you know, trying to advertise to the passersby, so I think they're owning it.And there's nothing inherently wrong. I myself am, begrudgingly admitting that I fit that description, and after a long flight across the country I was ravenous and just looking for a nice place to eat outside, breathe the Montreal air and listen to the Montreal sounds. I wanted to eat, and just be still after moving so fast all day long. That's what I did.I walked up and was seated immediately out front, as the street this is located on is closed to all vehicle traffic. It's a lovely walkway and there's a fountain nearby, with lots of foot traffic and peoplewatching to be had. The diners around me all spoke French but laughed in the universal language of good times, and I ordered.I started with the chevre salad, which was not what I was expecting but somehow even better. A small pot of hot chevre and a couple of toast points accompanied a salad of greens, split cherry tomatoes, and onions lightly dressed. I scooped, I stabbed, and I inhaled it all. Lovely.The lamb shank came next and it was rich and hearty and filling. The veggies that accompanied it were cooked but cold in the middle, which was the only down point, but I left so very stuffed and relieved from my journey that I wasn't bothered.The service was so quick and efficient, and I think my favorite little bit of all was the restroom in its black-and-white tile glory. So cute! The whole building--three stories--seems lovely. Not a soul was upstairs and only one party dined inside, but in winter I bet this is a wonderful place to sit and look down on the snowy streets below. Another reason to mark this and come back in another time.

Les deux gamins has such a nice decor but our food wasn't the best. We ordered the onion soup as appetizer, it was good. As for main meal, we wanted to get the butcher's cut. I made sure that they had it on their menu before arriving by calling the restaurant. The person over the phone confirmed with me that they always have the special butcher's cut. Once we arrived, they didn't have their special. My boyfriend and I were quite disappointed since it was his birthday. I read many reviews and chose this restaurant because of all their 5 stars ratings. We ended up choosing different meals. I wanted to get the salmon tartare but it was unavailable since it was only there for summer. The waitress proposed to change the salmon for smoked salmon which was fine. The hanger steak was just alright, nothing special about it. The service was really good. She was helpful but I guess we were mostly disappointed about the food.

Really great spot.  Indoor/outdoor dining.  Small menu but really good.  Started off with a board of a couple of cheeses, sliced meats, pate, pickled cauliflower and cod croquetes.  Really good.  Also had marinated frog legs. ExcellentParents really loved thier lamb shank, bro really liked his steak and i absolutely loved my Duck confit.  Bought a bottle of wine and for dessert we shared a delicious creme brulee.  $220 canadian.  Not bad at all!!

Very nice bistro restaurant. It is a mutli storey layout and it has a great atmosphere. Had their fixed price menu with the French onion soup to start. It wasn't a great French onion as it was a bit bland. My wife had the warm goat cheese salad which was great.Had the hanger steak with a parsnip puree and salad. It was amazing. Wife had the duck breast with roasted vegetables and that was very good.Service was nice and attentive.

This cute French bistro on Rue Prince Arthur has been a favorite of ours for a while.  We sat outside and  it was nice to people watch as we enjoyed our meals.   I got the poached cod and it was delicious (needed a bit of black pepper, but I do like things a bit spicier).   It come on top of some nice fresh vegetables.   My BF got the hanger steak and it was outstanding...always done perfectly.   If you order it medium rare, you will see some blood....Medium will be perfectly pink in the middle.Our friend Amy got a salmon tartar dish and it was outstanding.   Fresh tasting, nicely seasoned.  It came with crostini and fries (not crispy enough though)....Nice french bread basket is provided as a starter.   They have lots of selections of beer and wine.   They take credit cards.

Oh my word, what a meal!! I have Yelp & everyone's reviews to thank for in finding this gem. We started off with the beef tartare & French onion soup. Lots of onions in the soup, nice crispy layer, and tasted airy but flavorful. I was blown away by the beef tartare. All the beef tartare I've had this far had a mediocre taste & texture was off. I'm not sure what's done here, but the temp, texture, and flavor were spot on! For our main course, I had the Duck Confit while my boyfriend ordered the Lamb Shank. In both dishes, the meat fell right off the bone. Perfectly cooked, well seasoned, and absolutely divine! My mouth is watering reliving the memory. Sad to say I didn't have any room for dessert & sorely wish I did. Overall, including the warm hospitality & attentive service, this is a must-try restaurant if you're ever in Montreal!

First night in Montreal and if I'm ever back, I will stop here for their lamb shank. It was the perfect comfort food for a rainy day. And it was a great to introduce ourselves to French cuisine. While it may be a bit touristy, I didn't mind the ambiance at all. Paints were red and black with mirrors surrounding the restaurant. Very quaint. Good thing we made reservations a few days ahead because it was crowded. The food was delicious. We began with the french onion soup. Very tasty although I would have like the temperature to be higher for that steaming effect. The lamb shank was slowly braised with mashed potatoes and colorful roasted vegetables. Flavor tasted like a home cooked meal by grandma. The beef tartare was fresh, but could use a bit of salt and more crackers. Hanger Steak was made exactly to order, so we were very happy with the quality and outcome of a medium rare steak. Lastly, we also had the duck confit (a leg) that was seasoned well albiet a bit dry. Wish we got some desserts, but we were extremely full. Next time!
Just came home after having dinner here. Not one local, only tourists. Food just average. Disappointing..
Such a great restaurant! Every dish is so good! We have 6 people and we love the Burchers cut, duck confit, Lamb Flank and the dessert! Service is great! Worth waiting!
Wonderful little place for dinner, not too pricey and it's delicious! The service is good and so is the atmosphere. I enjoyed it very much!

Came here based on a recommendation from a friend. Great atmosphere and very kind waiter who gave great recommendations and explained every menu item to my family. The French onion soup was simply amazing. They used a lot of onions and the consistency of the soup was perfect.

I was looking for a nice restaurant at old Montreal for our last night in Montreal and I came up with this restaurant with high star. so decided to go there. food was ok but highly priced for the quality you getand was not a  romantic restaurant. It's just a small restaurant with some outdoor area at the sidewalk and ten minute drive from old Montreal.The reason they have high review is that they offer free dessert for the people who write reviews.

I just came back from Paris recently and had easily one of the worst beef tartares in my life there. Why? They put ketchup in it. It would seem that the over-touristifiction of Paris and the taste of tourists has affected the food in traditional French bistros. They are now putting ketchup in steak tartare to suit the palates of clueless American and Chinese tourists. Who would have thought that if you now want authentic continental French food, you can only find it in Montreal now? I came here for supper last Friday night with a friend and wanted to clear my memory and palate of that tartare in Paris. So I got the French Onion Soup, the Beef Tartare and closed off with the Creme Brulee. All of it was flawless and hit the spot. Even the checked black and white tiled floor is decidedly French. Service is very friendly and the ambiance here is quite casual.  I saw other tables ordering other items from their menu like their green salad, escargots, lamb shank and plate of cheeses and all of it looked great.

A very authentic restaurant with a very comprehensive menu of bistro fare. I was visiting town with my picky Cantonese-heritage parents who, after having lived in and assimilated fully into the US for over 40 years, still insist on going out for Chinese food when we travel. After too many mediocre experiences in Chinatown, I insisted on having real French-inspired food for dinner, and even my parents enjoyed the change in scenery for once.A foie gras torchon appetizer was almost entrée-sized, and was a nice, savory way to start the meal. We all elected meaty selections for our main courses, and these were nicely presented and of quite decent quality, whether a steak entrée, a duck confit dish, or, if I remember correctly, a pork belly dish. The pricing was perfectly appropriate given the overall size and quality of the offerings.Service was also quite reasonable. While things were very quiet the night we visited, the restaurant is quite large and can handle lots of people over several floors which can let in the outside air when the weather is warmer. Overall, a solid, decent choice for French bistro fare.

My husband and I stumbled on this restaurant our first night visiting Montreal. The food was so amazing we came back on our last night to enjoy it all over again. The second time around did not disappoint and we were sad to leave our new favorite restaurant in Montreal.If you have never been, without a doubt have the duck confit. By far the best meal. We ate duck throughout our entire stay in Montreal, and no restaurant or dish comes close. Every bite was delicious and just as good as the last. We can not recommend this restaurant enough.

Make a reservation to get in easily. Also get the Butcher's Cut! We ordered the rib eye for 6 peoples. The dish came with a glorious steak, salads, roasted veggies, and fresh fries in duck fat for $180. Well worth it! The foie gras, French onion soup and creme brûlée were good, but the steak stole the show!

We stumbled in here late at night after another restaurant we tried to go to was closed- and I am SO glad we did! It was amazing! Best meal we had in Montreal. I had steak with mashed root veggies and my friend had the duck confit - both were outstanding and the bread was delicious as well. Very friendly service and reasonable pricesWill definitely be back!
Ordered the best charcuterie board I've ever had but I wish there were more cheeses.  Sitting outside with perfect weather was great. Service was decent, nothing wrong just could've been more prompt.

Worth the money. People who said it's just avg for the price are mistaken. The food is tasty and absolutely delicious. The price was avg. The waiter was very informative about the dishes and how they were served. Food came at just the right time and We all enjoyed our meals.

Eating outside on a breezy August night with  a street folk band playing in the background made for a wonderful dinner at Les Deux Gamins. Their escargot was unique in its Spanish preparation, and lacked neither flavor nor surprise. The mushroom risotto came in just the right size, it was creamy and the mushrooms were delicious. The hanger steak was perfectly cooked atop a root vegetable purée that was creamy and not too heavy. The duck came with crispy roasted vegetables that made for a well rounded entree. I felt transported to the streets of Paris while enjoying wonderful food, company, and music.
The menu offers a mixed verity; the food is outstanding!!!!the service is good too.
Great food! Quick service. Friendly environment. Fish with pumpkin seeds and varies garments Shank of lamb w/ mashed potatoes.

This was the last place we ate on our trip to Montréal, and it was a perfect ending to a wonderful trip. The food was AMAZING!We started with the French onion soup and escargot. The soup was good, very traditional, nothing special. BUT the escargot was superb. It was served with a red pepper coulis. It really helped bring out the flavor of the snails.I ordered the cod, which was crusted with pumpkin seeds and some kind of nut. It was served with carrots and potatoes. The fish tasted so light and the carrots complimented it very well. We also got the Duck Confit, which was served with arugula and mushy peas. The duck was really good - crispy skin, very tinder and savory. Very well cooked. The peas were sweet and airy, complimenting the saltiness of the duck very well.We ended with the creme brûlée, which was fantastic and taste like there was fresh vanilla in it.I definitely recommend this place a a must visit for anyone's stay in Montréal!

Cute place, feels like you're in a Paris bistro on Montmarte. The food is great too, especially love their fois gras. For some reason though, Yelp indicated that this place is BYOB, well, that's not true. Their have their own wine menu with impressive variety.The service is good, even when it does get busy with tourists. The setting and ambiance makes it a perfect place for a date.

For our last night in Montreal I wanted to go to a fabulous French inspired restaurant. Les Deux did not disappoint! Service from start to finish is top notch and the food is divine. I ordered the French onion soup and the veggie salad for my dinner. My brother and father ordered the lamb (which literally could feed 4 people alone). The lamb is on a bed of mashed potatoes and carrots. Everything was cooked perfectly and honestly I couldn't have asked for a better last night in Montreal. Just look at my photos! The food was awesome!

Had a wonderful experience at Les Deux Gamins with my group of friends. Made a reservation on Yelp (super convenient) and table was ready for us when we arrived. The atmosphere was great - artsy decorations, vintage ceiling fans, roll open windows and all. There are outdoor spaces so I'm sure in the summer they fill out very quickly. The menu is compact, but in a way it's great cause it ensures quality. Wine by the glass is a bit pricey for the volume. But other than that, food and service was great.It's a 5 minute walk from the subway Sherbroke station on the Orange line. You'll pass by a park with a very nice gold rimmed fountain.We ordered:Country Terrine - rich and I can taste the herby flavour mixed in with the pate. Only 2 crostinis served - but also goes well with the toasted bread.French Onion Soup - agree with other reviews that it tasted just right and not too salty. It has lots of ingredients - soaked up all the soup, wish there was more!Duck confit - I loved the sweet pea puree and the arugula salad. The duck confit has a crispy skin and mild flavour, not overly salty. Some previous reviewers mentioned the skin is not crispy, but I can see they have improved based on the reviews.Other honourable mentions: fois gras, beef tartare, escargot, lamb shankYelp check in offer only applies to one serving per table.Thanks for the great experience. I look forward to visiting again in warmer weather!

Came here last night and had mixed reviews.  The ambience was really nice and romantic. The customer service was excellent and staff were attentive. But the lamb shank I ordered gave me food poisoning I have a pork allergy so they may have cooked the lamb next to pork oil who knows . But I wasn't thrilled. My husband's food also was way too rare, he ordered a steak. So just be cautious about what you order here. Otherwise it was nice!

The reason we went to this restaurant was to try the butcher's choose cut. It was ribeye on the day we went. We were about to scream when we saw the dish! It was huge!!! And the sides with salad, 2 kinds of potatoes and grilled veggies!!! All tasted great and satisfactory. While we were in Montreal we noticed something different from the US. The dish always comes with nice portion of real salad (not a cheaply iceberg Lettuce with over powering thick dressing)  and tasty potatoes, not one or the other. We loved the Montreal style.

I have to say management should consider staffing more waiters on weekends and other peak times. The servers were overworked the evening I visited. There were only 2 servers for the entire restaurant and it was relatively busy for a Sunday evening. The restaurant also has three floors of which two were being used for the evening. The servers were constantly running back and forth, we waited at least 45 minutes before we finally had to call a waiter over to our table to place our orders. I got the duck confit which was underwhelming and tasted overdone. However my friend's steak dish tasted quite good. It's definitely worth checking in on yelp here while they still have the offer for the free dessert. Don't expect to receive the full sized dessert, but it's free so I'm not complaining. The creme brûlée we got tasted incredible, I definitely would've got it even if it wasn't free.

I enjoyed my evening here at Les Deux Gamins. I came here with a group and we had an amazing time. We couldn't get enough of their bread that we had to ask for a second round. They were fresh and warm and the servers had no problem giving us more when we asked. The food was amazing and not overpriced. I'm drooling now just thinking about it. The ambiance is lovely and super relaxed. Can't wait to come back here!

I researched a great place for our last dinner in town and I wanted French food.... wow, was I in heaven. Seating outdoors was full so we opted for intimate dining inside. I made reservations even though there was ample seating indoors. The place is beautiful and our servers were so welcoming and attentive. The food was flavorful and perfectly prepared. The frog legs were delicious!!! The steak tartare is a huge plate so share it. The vibe was relaxed and just my speed. Loved it here!!!
I am so glad they are still open during current period, good luck and stay healthy. Like this old style, which really impressed me during last trip

Located in the beautiful Prince Arthur Street in Montreal, this restaurant definitely sets the benchmark to many French spots around. The minute you enter the place, you feel this French vibe. It's quite roomie and we had a nice table on the second floor. The menu is limited, very few items, but that's a great thing since it ensures that each plate is done perfectly and passionately. For starters, we had the Esscargots with peppers and Salmon tartare. I am a sushi lover and I was blown away by the freshness and the taste of the salmon. The duck Confit was fatty and full of flavor, exactly the perfect balance that you expect from the French cuisine. The lamb was beyond incredible. Finally, we had a creme brulee and a nice bottle of Pinot noir. Definitely a great and delicious dinner, very well spent money. The only downside is that they take long to cook the courses, but I felt rewarded in the end.

Amazing French food. Very well made. Small restaurant with small menu. But small menu really does mean everything that's on the menu is so well made because they're specialized in them. The waitress was wonderful and the other servers were nothing but polite and helpful. As a visitor in Montreal this was truly one of my favorite food spots. A bit more expensive than other Montreal classics like poutine but worth every single penny and really a bang for the buck when you consider the food you get. Of every restaurant I would consider going to in Montreal again, this would be my top choice. Exceeded my already high expectations without any doubt. Please give this small business all of your possible business.

Quintessential French-Canadian dining with the appeal of friendly service and multilevel balcony seating. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and patient w/our ordering. We had the Beef Tartar, Foie Gras, Duck Confit and French Onion Soup. The Beef tartar was a bit under seasoned but was chopped well and had great texture. The French onion soup was the best I've had - clean broth and not too salty as they tend to be. I loved the perfectly toasted cheese on top. My favorite was the Foie Gras au Torchon served with a fresh fig. My least favorite was the Duck Confit which was fall off the bone tender but was missing a crispy skin. I also thought the accompanying pea purée was too pasty. It could have benefitted from some light crème. I liked the limited menu option as well. You don't need a huge menu if you make a few things very well.

Les Deux Gamin illustrates why Yelpers should be allowed to give 3.5 star ratings for restaurants that are perfectly good but nothing more.  The restaurant itself is pleasant in ambience--a small bistro feel that worked just fine but didn't add to the overall experience.  The staff dressed distractingly casually (not in a good sense--mismatched and kind of sloppy looking).  The food was good but not great.  My wife had the goat cheese and honey starter, which was nice, and I really enjoyed the escargot, prepared in a non-traditional manner (nicely seasoned and served with a little tomato sauce and probably baked--very tasty and a relief from the "drenched in butter" recipe so often used for escargot). For my main I had the lamb shank over mashed potatoes.  The lamb was tender and flavorful.  My wife's poached cod (was it frozen?) was dry and a little meh, lacking in flavor.  Since we had "checked in" on Yelp we earned a free dessert. Don't get your hopes up, though. The ramekin of creme brûlée (chef's choice since it was free) was so small I didn't think ramekins came in that size (think a little larger than doll house furniture).  Wine list by the glass was limited but full-poured.   In a city with so many great restaurants I would probably not return.  That is my definition of a 3.5 star experience.

Once again the duck confit was simply perfection. So tender and juicy. Aldo had the special of the day warm goat cheese entree, love it.The service was super friendly and the atmosphere was very romantic.One of my fav. in Montreal!

As a food blogger from the USA this restaurant was great for the most part. Close quarters but I'd assume nothing less from a restaurant in the city. Menu was small but made it easy to choose. I loved that the waiter could really explain intricate details about the dishes from the presentation, cooking times, area of the country the meat/cheese was sourced, and the flavor profiles. Very helpful for a my non French speaking self. Appetizers were phenomenal got the Discovery board and was pleasantly impressed with the herbs and honey flavors incorporated into the sausages. Entrees included the rack of lamb and the duck confit. Rack of lamb was amazing, melt in your mouth, super lovely flavors, presentation was also on point. For the duck the flavors were great, presentation was a bit much It needed a bit more color. And the duck was over cooked making it a bit hard to chew. The dessert was lovely as well, good but nothing too special, presentation was very good. I would definitely reccomend this place because for the most part the dishes were lovely especially at the price points they have. It makes it feel like a steal especially in Montreal!
The menu is fresh and the flavors are paired with great detail. Such a great meal and comfortable atmosphere!
Excellent service and awesome food. We had the Fois Gra and it was delicious. The hanger steak was excellent and was a good value. This is near the Mt Royal and I would recommend this restaurant!

I really loved this place! The food was great and it was very romantic!The starters are quite filling actually so if you're not that hungry I wouldn't recommend both.I had the escargot which was really good and I would recommend.I also had the steak which was done to my taste.But the best part was the panacota  (don't think I wrote that right) dessert is simply to die for! Really nice people at the resto as well.

Incredible food with incredible service! We loved everything about this place. What a gem! The steak and lamb dishes were perfection and portions are generous. We were able to sit in the second floor with the giant open pull up windows. One of the best things about our trip to Montreal!

Had a lovely dinner just sitting at the bar.  Classic French cuisine. The staff is happy to describe anything you aren't familiar with. Impeccable wine list at fair prices. Multiple levels of seating indoors and out. This should be on you list if you're staying Montreal for a night.
We always have a great experience here. A little pricey but the food is great quality. I wish they'd bring the duck Mac and Cheese back. Was the best!

I think this is more of a 3.5 star review.Service was great, prices were reasonable but the food left something to be desired. Let me explain!The french onion soup, which was the main motivation for us to go, was very good and on the sweeter side. We enjoyed it! My friend got the steak and it was very tasty, perfectly cooked and seasoned. She liked it and so did I. I got the lamb shank on mashed potatoes which was slightly bland but perfectly cooked. We both enjoyed it as well. Now what was the issue beyond the slightly bland lamb? Our entrees were cold! Not warm-ish, not lukewarm, not room temp but just plan cold. My friend didn't say anything because if you warm up steak it would no longer be cooked as well as it was and be overcooked. I did tell the waitress that my lamb was cold (I am not the best at hiding my emotions).  She took it back and they warmed it or remade it (in the meantime I had some of my friends steak and more bread, so then I was too full for the lamb lol) and somehow it was only slightly warmer.Not sure why they couldn't get the food temps right but the ambiance was very Parisian and the staff was very friendly. Check it out and maybe ask for your food extra warm?
Like everything we ordered! Everything tastes amazing! Especially the lamb shank, so tender, and the sides are also delicious.

My friends and I came here on the last night of our Montreal trip and it was the perfect spot. Food 5/5: I admit I don't know too much about French food but everything was delicious. I started with the Escargots which had tender snails and fresh greens. For my main I had the Fresh Egg Tagliatelles which was some of the best homemade pasta I've ever had. Some of my friends started with the French Onion Soup which was a huge portion and oozing with cheese. The broth was very tasty although I wish there was more of it, it all soaked into the bread. Another friend had the Duck Confit which was fall off the bone good and now every time she has duck in Toronto, she complains its not as good. The house wine was also quite nice, a chardonnay but not overly dry, $30 for the bottle.Service 5/5: Our waiter was really nice and attentive, taking the time to answer our questions about the menu. Also, because we were a big group, it took us a while to get a table so we were one of the last people there but he never made us feel rushed.

A few years ago I came up to Montreal for my bday. I had no clue where to go and a friend recommended this place. Many trips and years latter I keep coming here.It looks like a typical french style restaurant but the food is divine and the service is great and friendly ( and cute) and helpful. I have yet to been steered wrong. The staff switches between french and english easly and evening understands my french when I'm stumbling though it and they make sure you know and can get home after a few drinks. The Lamb shank I drool thinking about it, it just falls of the bone. The soups and fois gras fillme up. They are always very accommodating, there was a issue with my last reservation ( it was a open table issue not theirs) but they went out of they way to accommodate me.

This delightful French Bistro stood out among others in Montreal. What a lovely outdoor patio and the food was amazing, especially the French Onion Soup and melt-in-the-mouth Lamb Shank! Their desserts are not to be skipped. Summer weather was perfect for alfresco dining. The whole ambiance felt like you were transported to a quaint little town in Europe.

It was my first time in Montreal and my BF and I decided to come visit this place because we saw how amazing the  yelp reviews were. Upon seating, the waitress was very friendly. We had great vibes about the place. We ordered the steak tartare for appetizer and that was great. I ordered the duck confit and my bf ordered the hangar steak. Probably because we usually get much bigger portions in NY that we were surprised the portions were on the smaller side. The entrees weren't pricey so we were like okay, you get what you pay for. Both entrees were delicious. What took off two stars and made our experience unpleasant was:1. There was hair on our bread 2. The waitress only charged us for 3 glasses of wine rather than 4 and we thought she comped us because there was hair on the bread. My BF thanked her and she said "NO i have to take the bill back and recharge you again." This was after we got the bill and we were ready to swipe. It was only $8 per glass so nbd but the fact that she took it back after we were ready to pay made it seem very rude. We would've tipped her extra in the same amount anyways.

We came to visit from nyc, and we found this place on yelp.  I have to say it was just a absolute deligh.  The service was friendly and very welcoming.  We had a large party of 12 people and they were able to set us up at a nice spot on the 2nd floor near the window.  The food was really light and not over powering in salt.  We expected french food to be quite heavy or thick, but it was not. A few of us did a family style.  We got the pate, duck confeti, lamb on a shank and the butchers cut. We were really happy with our meal, and presentation was top notch.  The waiter was able to get us a Pineapple flambe and crem brulee for dessert!  I will have the video and pics posted.

We made a last minute reservation here and came at about 8:30pm on a Monday night. When we arrived the waiter was really busy and didn't seat us immediately. I thought he was being rude but when we did get seated he was very sweet and apologized profusely for the wait. I soon after realized that he seemed to be the ONLY waiter working in the entire restaurant (the first floor was completely full and the second floor where we were seated was half full.) I felt so bad for him but he was able to serve us pretty quickly considering that. For appetizers we got the French onion soup (which the waiter told us they are known for) and the fois gras. The fois gras was classic and tasty. The soup was one of the best French onion soups I've had. It was half cheese and bread (always what I secretly hope for when I order this) and had great flavor. Not overly salted like some. For main courses I had the duck confit and my mom had the hanger steak. My duck confit was very tasty and tender and crispy-salty on the outside. However many of the potatoes it came with seemed to be pretty undercooked and raw-tasting/crunchy. My mom's steak was perfectly medium rare but a bit cold. The waiter was also nice enough to give her fries with it.The ambiance is cute and French-feeling and I believe the walls open when it's nice outside (it was raining pretty hard when we went.) The prices aren't for every night, but they're fine for a once in a while tasty French food treat. Also bonus points for being close to the Metro (near the Sherbrooke station.) I would definitely go back!

Very good French restaurant on the best street in Montreal. Prince Arther Street is quaint and beautiful, and when you dine at Les Deux Gamins you will feel like you are at a little French bistro in Paris. We started with the escargot and gazpacho. Both were delicious and very generous portions. I had the steak and my dad got the leg of lamb. Both were delicious but the leg of lamb was truly exceptional. This place is a must try in Montreal!

Small neighborhood restaurant with wonderful food and service. Parking is horrible around this area. If you plan to drive to this restaurant park at the school near the park around the corner. The food was excellent. We ordered the steak, lamb shank and the white fish.They were all flavorful. The price is very reasonable for French cuisine.

Best onion soup ever, the beef tartare is a great choice. We also ordered duck confit and pan steak, however they weren't as astonishing and tasty as the onion soup. We will definitely return for the onion soup and perhaps the  tartare.

Total jerks.  Had reservation for 8:15 - arrived at 8:00 and checked in with a server who asked my name and seating preference (indoor or outdoor).  Since it was 90 degrees outside and no AC inside - we opted for outside. He said it would be about 15 minutes which was fine since we were early.  After about 35 minutes I noticed other parties being seated who arrived after us so I went to ask about it. The "manager" suddenly appeared and basically said that it didn't matter that we had reservations and that he was going to continue to seat other parties in front of us....that arrived after us.  He said we could sit inside - that was all a reservation guaranteed.  Pathetic.

I made a reservation through opentable for dinner here on a sunday with no problems. Arrived there a bit late but was seated immediately on the main floor. I ordered a bottle of wine and the lamb shank. The lamb wasn't bad but it wasn't amazing either. For the price, I expected the lamb to be much better, however it was an extremely large portion and I eventually finished it at home. My friend got the tagliatelle and said it was great but it was a pretty small portion. She finished it within 5 minutes and when she wanted to order the creme brulee for dessert, they said they didn't have any more.The #1 thing that bothered me was that there were small bugs everywhere, I had to constantly kill them on our table or on the wall next to us, which isn't the most pleasant thing to do when I'm trying to eat.

I visited this French bistro a few weeks back and loved it!! This place has a cozy atmosphere, the tables are small and close together but it is warm and inviting. The food here is amazing and I highly recommend it! We ordered two appetizers and one main and thoroughly enjoyed everything. To start we had a French onion soup loaded with ingredients and it smelled delicious! The bread to cheese ratio was good the soup was not too salty or too oily. It might be the best French onion soup I've had to date. Then we got the escargot. This one was also a winner. It was not a butter pesto dish but rather one with a red pepper sauce. It sounds weird but it was totally delicious! For the main, we had the lamb shank. This was cooked very well and it did not smell of lamb. The shank was braised slowly and was very tender. The bread and butter that came with the meal was usual fare but it was a nice touch. The place opens at 5:30 and it is busy by the time we got there around 6 pm. The service is great and people were friendly. Reservation is recommended but we were able to walk in and be seated right away because we got there early.

Sigh... where do I begin. I am in Montreal at least one a year. I like to try new eateries while I am in town. My husband's son selected this restaurant and four out of six of us were disappointed. My girlfriend who is a native of Montreal ordered the duck confit, I ordered the  Cornwall chicken, my husband had the lamb shank, another ordered the hanger steak. When the food arrived I could already see I was going to be hungry. The duck was so dry I thought my friend was going to choke on it, my chicken was bitter and I was not sure if it was over salted, the shank was ok as was the steak nothing special. The restaurant was nicely decorated and the terrace provided a nice view of the street.

Mark and I drove over from Clayton, NY after his Mark Sganga Trio performed at the Clayton Opera House. We decided on Les Deux Gamins and we're so glad we did. Food was excellent, service was excellent!!

I had the special mushroom risotto--amazing. My daughter had the anglais de bœuf on a bed of puréed cauliflower. The server said it would be medium but it was rare & she couldn't eat much of it. We ate on the early side, outdoors at a cutesy French table. There was some cigarette smoke.

I've enjoyed dinner here twice on my trips to Montreal and had a great time both times. Les Deux Gamins is located in a cute area and set up like restaurants I've been to in France (ie. the small tables, two floors). This definitely adds to the whole authenticity and atmosphere of eating French food. The service was great and the staff provided recommendations on food selection. I recall both the duck confit and the salmon tartare to be delicious! Pricing is reasonable.

Food is hit or miss. Some items were good, some were a complete failure. Foie Gras was hands down the worst I've had and I have had many. Brownie was also highly disappointing.Service was great no issues here - I simply couldn't recommend

+.5 for serviceMontreal has its awesome local food, but once in a while you have to look beyond and have the cuisine which resembles this province: French food. It's awesome, comforting, and most of all it's not greasy at all.I chose Les Deux Gamins due to its excellent reviews and close proximity to the Metro. Even the walk to the restaurant was quite nice, as you pass thru a park and some Victorian-style houses.Upon entering the restaurant, you can immediately tell that it's an authentic French restaurant with the traditional French setup. The tables are small, the seats are also smaller, and the restaurant has several floors. You are served by a male waiter, and the person pouring water is a female dressed in traditional French attire.The menu isn't extensive, but it covers many of the French staples. I went with the French Onion Soup, escargots, butcher cut (short rib), and creme brulee du jour. Before everything came, we were served with homemade French bread, which was not surprisingly on the hard side, but it tasted quite good for what it's worth.The French Onion Soup was delicious and had that excellent onion aroma. The cheese was also plentiful and melted well with the soup, and the croutons also mashed well with the soup. The escargots were plentiful, and the garlic add-on was a nice touch. The butcher cut, which we shared, was grilled medium rare, which in this case was excellent. However, I would say that I had better beef in other restaurants before, and unless it's a part that's unique it's not something would order again. Finally, the creme brulee had an excellent cream texture, and is something I would definitely order again for dessert.Service was excellent, and we were attended to the whole way by both the waiter and the lady. I was definitely pleased with my visit, and would surely come back whenever I'm in Montreal.

Decent French Bistro with some unique takes on French cuisine. The classics, were disappointing, though. We had the French onion soup.  The broth had no flavor. Perhaps getting there so close to closing was the reason. In a city with as many restaurants as Montreal this one was completely mundane. Presentation was beautiful on our Foie Gras appetizer but not thrilled with the flavors.
Food and service here is good. Nothing mind blowing, just decent.The ambiance being outside was nice and the service was good. But nothing really to write home about.
We had such a great experience here! Friendly service & quality food. The bread & French onion soup were both super fresh! The prices are decent! Reminds me of food in Paris! Loved it.

Absolutely disgusting. The waiters were sweating into the food. By far the worst dining experience I have ever had. We (unfortunately) went here during the heatwave in July. The restaurant's AC broke in the kitchen, and with 95+ degree (Farenheit) heat, two cooks passed out. The heat in the kitchen was over 50 Celsius according to our waiter. When I asked if the chef was okay, the wait staff said "I don't know - but we're handling it." Staff members told us this, and "apologized for the delay". We were horrified that they didn't shut the restaurant down right then, but the manager demanded they keep serving. Apparently he also took over in the kitchen.Waiters were sweating on everything, and into the food.The food itself was nothing great - and I was worried about illness from the unsanitary conditions. But the waiters were clearly in distress, and that was the most upsetting part. They were sweating profusely the entire time. I saw our waiter drip sweat into the food of the table next to us. It was horrifying and disgusting - and people's safety and welfare were disregarded because the manager/owner wanted to make a few extra bucks.Please do not go here - and let them know that this is not acceptable. I don't know what kind of health standards Canadian businesses operate under. If this were the US, it would have been shut down within hours and the owner fined tens of thousands of dollars. This is by far the worst dining experience I have ever had. Per the news, 12 people have died in Montreal from the heat wave, and I hope this restaurant did not contribute to that. Shame on you.
It's good but it's not overwhelmingly good compared to other escargot, duck, lamb shank I have had if you are looking for 1st class french experience
Lovely atmosphere.  Excellent food and service.  We sat outdoors and thoroughly enjoyed the environment.   The salmon tartare was the best I've ever had and I eat a lot of salmon!  Highly recommend!

Very nice bistro with nice selection of dishes. Loved the steak tartar Appetizer. Served seemed a bit overwhelmed with too many customers but to be expected on a busy night. Our group all tried different main dishes and I would have to say I loved the lamb shank the best.
As a first timer I thought this place was nice and the food is well prepared. I'll visit again for sure.

Charming French bistro in a converted town house that has three levels. The Duck confit was superbly rich, and the service was very friendly and attentive. We also sampled the crene brûlée, French Oinion Soup, poached cod, and mushroom risotto. Everyone in our party was very pleased with their meal. Highly recommended.

Excellent place to have a nice dinner outdoors. The food served here is of excellent quality; the fois gras is very tasteful, the soups served here are delicious and wet the appetite for sure. The main courses are all delicious -- juicy, tender, and tasty -- as all main courses should be.

Hubby and I had dinner on a Saturday evening and although made reservations, probably didn't need them (we were there at 6:30pm). It seems they don't get busy until about 8pm so would advise reserving if you want a later dinner. On to the food... It was awesome! I had the duck confit followed by creme brûlée and hubby had the beef with a green salad to start and the pineapple flambé for dessert. Everything was delicious! It was also well priced. Our dinner, with a glass of wine each, came to around $150 with tax and tip. Service was quick, attentive and overall pleasant. The staff are bilingual, so those that don't speak French, do not be intimidated to try them out :) We were practicing our French and appreciated the staffs' patience. I would definitely come back the next time we are in Montreal and I would recommend that friends check it out. The experience really was like being at a bistro in Paris.

This place is excellent! Ordered the discovery board and love the choice of the day. The beef hanger steak was perfectly cooked as well, we had a great dinner here. Only reason why I gave it a 4-star is that they didn't have Foie gras for the night and we came all the way from Toronto for it..otherwise it's perfect!

I'm always nervous when friends warn me that the restaurant were going to is relatively un-vegetarian friendly. Sometimes, though, that's where real gems of dishes for us herbivores can be found! Such was the case at Les Deux Gamins, where besides a delicious bottle of rosé, I enjoyed:  Frites/French Fries ($4): Everything I ever craved was in these fries. Julienne cut, salty, crispy on the outside, melt-in-your-mouth fluffy on the inside, and dredged through whatever that dangerously delicious white sauce was (I don't want to know what's in it, do I?)? I probably could have just eaten baskets of these all.night.long. with endless glasses of wine and been entirely satisfied.Salade de chèvre chaud et noix de Grenoble/Warm goat cheese and walnut salad (16.50): This was one of the lone options I had for my entree choices, and it was grand. A heaping mound of greens with a walnut dusting and four sizable slices of toast each covered with a thick slab of goat cheese (and did I taste a hint of honey on it, too?). Yes, please! The goat cheese was beyond plentiful and generous, too, more than I've ever seen at a restaurant before... so if you like cheese... and you're a vegetarian... I promise, you will not go hungry with this option (also, be sure to have more rosé to wash each bite down with as goat cheese itself can be very dry in the most amazing of ways). So despite the lack of choices, would I come back here again? Absolutely. Sitting outside right on Prince Arthur does, as another reviewer mentioned, feel very much like Europe. It helped that a gentleman showed up to play French music for a spell, that the young girls next to us were excitedly talking about their backpacking trip, that the waitstaff was attentive, that my company was lovely, the weather was perfect, and that the rosé was divine after a long day of flying. Couldn't have had a more "just right" dinner my first night in Montreal!

pretty good here! very small and romantic. near all the fun places in the city.  their escargots, hanger steak, beef tartare, and french onion soup is really good.  MUST ORDER THE FRENCH ONION SOUP. its sweet, and not salty at all.  usually french onion soups could be really salty, but their is perfectly seasoned, and the onions are more on the sweeter side. the croutons/bread in it were cripsy, but perfectly soaked in the center.recommend making a reservation.  the place is 3 stories, and the stairs and the seating area are a bit tight.

This is a cute little restaurant in Milton Montreal. The service was great and our dinner was pretty good too. I had the beef hanger steak and my sister had the lamb shank. The meat was nice and tender for both our entrees and the flavor was good as well.
French onion soup was just amazing great service and great food! Highly recommended!!

Great French bistro spot! This was in a quaint area of Montreal and not very touristy, which is a plus. We came on new years eve and we're able to make a reservation with no problem. The service was good, but nothing crazy. The food was awesome! We got the escargot, foie gras, French onion soup and the braised lamb shank. All were cooked perfectly with nothing left on any of the plates. This was definitely traditional French food done right. I would definitely come back if I were back in montreal! The restaurant is adorable with very cute decorations. They have an outdoor area, which was closed in the winter for obvious reasons (snow!!). The price was just right and not expensive at all! You will not be disappointed if you come here!!!

This is another best French restaurant in Montréal that you should try if you get to visit. The place has a nice French décor. Nothing special to it, but that wasn't what we came here for. We got seated and started with a nice bottle of bordeaux. And then we ordered Escargots and Salmon Tartare for appetizers. They were amazing!Two bottles of Bordeaux, 2 appetizers and 5 entrées plus tip for CAD 255. Not bad at all!

Very good place to have a nice quiet meal! It was located in this little square that seemed very much like Europe to me. We went during the evening so most of the shops were closed, but I'd like to get back and see it during the day. I went with the lamb shank in bbq sauce with whipped potatoes, the wife had this cornwall chicken dish and my daughter just had a cheese plate. My meal was AWESOME, served in this little cast iron skillet and was cooked to perfection! Wifey liked her chicken dish, but not as much as I liked my dish! The service was great and all in all it was a fantastic meal!

The duck confit was beautiful. Green pea mousse, perfectly crispy duck skin, arugula salad dressed with a sweet and bright blueberry sauce....I'm still dreaming about it. The beef tartare and the French onion soup were also great dishes that still make my taste buds tingle. Wonderful service, wonderful atmosphere. Very highly recommend.
Great atmosphere and even better food and service! I highly recommend the lamb shank. There's no picture because there's nothing to show anymore, it was that good! :) Bon appetite!
The lamb is impressive. I am okay with the duck confit. The inside is a bit too dry and hard to chew. Good experience overall
Great food and accommodating staff. Good location for walking around after dinner.

Good food. Many choices for appetizers and main courses. Prices were very reasonable. It had a nice neighborhood restaurant feel to it. Our server was pleasant. She offered to have us taste the dessert wine before deciding to order it. They have plenty of seating on various levels (probably outdoors too in summer)

Amazing dinner if you're looking for French cuisine. A but disappointed that the escargot was not traditional but it didn't disappoint for the winter! Quaint atmosphere and a very charming part of Montreal.

First time in Montreal and decided to try Les Deux Gamins.The soups were awesome - had the French Onion and the 'creamed root,' with fresh bread . . .The Hangar Steak was perfectly prepared (medium-rare) and the lamb shank was too much to finish!Give it a try!

Delicious food in a beautiful outdoor seating location.  Five stars despite some minor service hiccups. We made a reservation through yelp.  It wasn't clear to me they received it, but they had an outdoor table for us, so yay!  My wife and I are both lactose intolerant, and the waitress was both knowledgeable about menu items and helpful with substitutions. We each ordered green salad.  She had the lamb shank while I had duck Condit, each with plans to share.Salads took a while.  Eventually a food runner came out and offered our salads to two other tables befofe we flagged her down.  Salads were tasty despite some wilted bits we avoided.  Simple butter lettuce with spring greens. No bread arrived.Entrees took a while. Totally worth waiting for. Lamb shank was tender and delicious.  Barbecue sauce was nothing an American would recognize as such but tasty nonetheless. Sweet, complex flavor, but no smoke, chili, or bite really.  Duck confit fell off the bone and barely stayed on the plate we ate it so fast. Potatoes and veggies were great, too, but were substitute sides.  Your mileage may vary. Then the bread arrived.  Good for finishing up the sauce.
Great food. Very nice staff. I will definitely return when back in Montreal. BTW, if you like French Onion soup, it's a must!

We went on a Tuesday night and the restaurant was packed full of people.  Unfortunately, there was only one waiter on duty which wasn't enough to service the restaurant.  He tried very hard to accommodate everyone but a popular restaurant should have extra staff available.  We had to constantly flag him down for service.  No bread was offered, food came out ice cold, and we left slightly disappointed.  Food quality was fine but nothing extraordinary.

Came here on Valentine's day evening and the service was a bit of a mess. I can understand that they were packed but the staff just seemed completely unprepared- they served us the wrong dishes twice and glasses were dropped so many times while we were there that I started to feel sorry for them. Our server did apologize for the long waits though. That being said, I did enjoy my food (I ordered the French onion soup and risotto which came with mushrooms). My boyfriend wasn't too satisfied with his duck confit though. He said it tasted like high school cafeteria food.. I was also planning on using my Yelp check-in to claim a free dessert but decided against it, seeing that they were so busy.

YUM. We had the lamb and duck. The lamb literally fell off the bone and was absolutely delicious. We were very lucky to stumble across this place after a long day of driving. We sat outside which was lovely, with a fountain trickling in the background. Definitely recommend!

The ambiance was like a cute little French restaurant in Paris. Some of the best wine I ever had. I had some Bordeaux. First time I ever had esgarots...so worth it!! Didn't think I would actually enjoy it, but I absolutely loved it. Had the poached cob and it was pretty good; a bit plain without any sauce.

One more star for the attention taken by the restaurant to address my issue and reply to my comment. I appreciate that level of customer service. I was really looking forward to this place after reading all the great Yelp reviews. What a disappointment! The service was rushed and impersonal, the dishes SO average (my steak was severely overcooked and came with cooked lettuce that was completely flavorless). We had dinner in less than 20 minutes and it felt that the staff was more concerned by turning tables than providing a memorable experience.

This is a really down-to-earth, quality French bistro...At first I was about to throw a major Quebecois tantrum when I was told they ran out of duck confit; I was SO in the mood for crispy duck confit :(BUT the onion soup was top notch, the filet mignon was very good (although perhaps a tad overcooked) and the mac n cheese was seriously THE BEST mac n cheese I have ever tasted. No cuisine does indulgence quite like French cuisine. I will post a pic...check it out.Also, the service was excellent...our server recommended a 2004 French red (blend) that he said was a 'great deal' for the price. And he was bang on. Great spot!

I went here with my group of friends and I can say with confidence that this place delivers in terms of food and service.The interior of this place is very cute and I enjoyed the ambiance a lot. Great music, great staff.I sampled a lot of my friend's plates as well and I thought that each entree was balanced so well in terms of flavour and also had big portions for the price, especially for French bistro food. I have a big appetite and this place left me very full. The salmon tartare was delicately seasoned and the beef tartare was complemented nicely wish fresh greens. It is so rare to see such fresh greens as garnish in Toronto. For dessert, there was creme brulee (it's very big!) and the flambed pineapples. The pineapples tasted heavily of alcohol, which may be a plus for some.Overall, very satisfied with my experience.

This was the worst experience of my recent Montreal trip. First of all, I ordered foie gras and they did not have it. They also removed trout and sea bass from the menu. So my options were limited. I then settled for escargot for my appetizer and a type of white fish dish (recommended by the server). The escargot tasted like boiled snail on top of spinach with no seasoning whatsoever. The fish dish was simply grilled fish, asparagus and uncooked rice. Overall, it was so bland with very minimal seasoning (to the point that I had to add salt to my food for it to taste somewhat seasoned). I was totally disappointed in this restaurant in every way. The service was mediocre, food was not worth the price, and I do not recommend anyone coming here for a nice dinner. I don't normally write reviews but this restaurant was so particularly bad that I feel like there are other nicer places in Montreal one should try than going to this one. It definitely does not deserve 4 stars.

My Order: Duck Confit (delicious)Pros+ FOOD: very delicious. While I'm not surprised that the serving was so small (it's french food after all), the duck was quite moist and delicious. + PATIO: the doors to the restaurant were large and open which allowed for the enjoyment of the great weather despite being situated in doors. Cons- W/R: only one per sex. The design of the washroom was inconvenient as the water from the sink was so close to the sink that you couldn't wash your hands without touching the sink's surface (which only serves to make your hands dirty as opposed to cleaner).- SERVICE: the waiter gave me the dirtiest look when I decided to skip an app and opt for an entree and a drink instead. Excuse me? For the premium prices that I'm paying, the least I should come to expect is top notch service (-2 points). We also would've wanted split bills but it comes as no surprise that the waiter didn't ask before handing us our bill. tl;dr? good food. shitty service.

We were in Montreal for a total of 10 hours and decided to catch dinner at les deux gamins before heading home. My friends and I ordered the braised lamb shank, the beef hanger steak and the cornwall chicken. For me, the lamb shank lacked flavor and was underwhelming. I could barely make out most of the side veggies because of the heavy bbq sauce. My friends enjoyed both the beef and the chicken, noting that both were perfectly cooked and accompanied by complimenting sides.

Amazing food and people are super friendly! We ordered a French onion soup, duck confit and a steak. Food is great and remember to check into Yelp for a mini desert- a crime brulette! I wish they have more servers though as the food came out really slowly and it was hard to catch my own waitress' attention.

Made reservations Saturday night for my bday dinner. Service was pleasant and attentive. The seating was a little tight but not too crowded. Table and chairs were tiny, not what'd you'd expect for a restaurant of this caliber. I ordered the discovery board and the lamb shank. Both were pretty average. Nothing to rave about. Will have to try something with a little more zip next time.

Overall a poor experience. The atmosphere isnt romantic or upscale it's café style and a bit rough and ready. They have a small menu and my food wasnt hot and was dry and not tasty. The resturant did try and make amends after I didn't eat some of it which was nice. We chose it because of the yelp ranking buf it wasn't what we were looking for. My partners food was nice apparently.

I have been wanting to come here for awhile now. First time, it was closed; second time, fully booked. Finally got here on a week night and got a table. There was the pre-set meal special, which I got the snails for starter and cheese risotto for the main course. The snails were sautéed with some spinach and cherry tomato, and lots of olive oil. It was well seasoned but very greasy. The cheese risotto was very cheesy and tasty. It was a dish well done. My boyfriend got the salmon for started, he complained it was too salty. But he did like the duck confit that he ordered. For me, the duck confit was dry. We did got a free dessert for checking in to this restaurant. The service was just so so, our waiter never checked on us but the bus girl was super nice and came by now and then. I wouldn't come back though

Loved the terrace and our waitress Agathe was super helpful and friendly, but the food can use some attention. The tartares were fresh, but tasteless. The rizotto was well cooked, but could use a new recipe. I do hope they decide to improve their food offering as this place has a lot going for it. Oh and their baguette was excellent!

Great food and amazing service. Had the foie gras and duck confit. Both were delicious! Ended up devouring the plates. Atmosphere is also very nice with good music and the waitress was very cordial and helpful. Not too expensive and great value for the money. Would highly recommend.

I had the most frustrating experience as a tourist here. This was a Friday night so understandably it was busy. I'm familiar with the dinner rush; I'm from NYC. I usually give the restaurants I review the benefit of the doubt but this was the worst dining experience I have had thus far. If I could give zero stars I would. We, a party of 5, came at 8 pm and waited about 15 minutes and were seated. From the time we were seated until 35 minutes later the only service that we received was a server pouring water for us. Nothing else. No one came by to take out orders, no one came to see how were doing, no apology for the wait. All that happened was a server walking repeatedly past us to serve the other table near us. At first, I thought it was a cultural thing, maybe I had to flag down a waiter. A few nods and waves brought NOTHING. After 35 minutes and 5 hangry people, we left. I can't even comment on the food as all I had was their water. As a restaurant, the food is only one aspect of a good dining location; it doesn't matter how good the food is when the service is severely lacking.

Les Deux Gamins was simply stunning. It was the perfect dinner to finish off the holiday. I wouldn't want to bore you with the details but the menu had a wide variety that I couldn't bring myself to choose what I wanted, therefore my friend and I settled for 5 different entrees that covered the spectrum of our cravings and we also had a bottle of wine to accompany all the exquisite dishes we were served.  Merci Dounia because the service was excellent.

Would have liked to have loved this place. Sadly it just didn't cut it for me. May have been an off day. But the food was served cold and meat was a little tough fo my taste. Perhaps an off day but reluctant to try again.

This is a very delicious restaurant to eat at. We tried a lot of the French food and it was really good. The food they made tasted amazing! The food was all flavorful and the price was reasonably priced. The service and ambiance made it a perfect family dinner.
Pretty good.   Sat outside ambience was nice food was good. Wine recommendation was spot on.

A French restaurant that requires a lot of patience, but promises a luxurious meal. Their hanger steak was beautifully cooked with a wine reduction and had the most delectable side of potatoes. Their lamb shank was tender, and melted in your mouth. In addition, the warm goat cheese salad was a great appetizer to share amongst two people and was delightful with every bite until my stomach was satisfied. The only downside is that this place has a long wait, and their entrees are a little too conservative on the salt. In the summertime, try to get a table outside and relish the Parisian style of leisure eating that this restaurant promotes.

Four stars for great service, food & Location!My boyfriend and I came around 630 on a Friday evening to an almost empty house. This was a bit odd we thought - seeming to think 630 would be prime dining time. We had set reservations, but looking back it definitely wasn't necessary.We started with the goat cheese salad & soup du jour which was butternut squash. These were both very tasty, but the goat cheese salad truly stood out. It was a typical green salad with a light dressing & the goat cheese was served on the side as more of a dip. By the end of the salad my boyfriend and I were finding as many random things as we could to dip in the goat cheese. I probably could've eaten a gallon of it - SO GOOD. Goat cheese lovers unite. For our main dishes we ordered the lamb shank & duck. We both agreed it was more than enough food, especially on the lamb shank. It was massive! But, Overall, we both agreed we enjoyed the duck over lamb. We got the creme brûlée for dessert which wasn't anything special, but was a nice way to end the meal.

Great and affordable French bistro eats...in the heart of Montreal!Rus and I made reservations to dine here, and were greeted with extremely courteous service throughout the entirety of our meal.We ordered the french onion soup, beef tartare, duck confit and braised lamb shank. After ordering, the hostess walked us through the wine list and helped us choose something that would pair well with our meal. Wines by the glass were also very affordable (most of the options were under $10CAD/glass).The food was great! The french onion soup was rich and delicious. A bit on the breadier side, but I still enjoyed it very much. Rus also enjoyed the beef tartare. It came with fried capers, which I had never seen before (but they were delicious)!Our entrees were so good! I love the duck confit and the lamb shank was also very rich. The portions were pretty large, but so good that we just couldn't stop eating.We ended our meal with the creme brulee dessert (free with Yelp check-in), it was eh...but I won't complain about a free dessert (maybe spring for the bread pudding though)!Les Deux Gamins is perfect for a date-night outing. The ambience is perfect and the staff will make sure that you have a great experience.

Oh my my my - C'est FANTASTIQUE in absolutely every way possible! Started with an appetizer of the escargot (snails) du jour - which they described as "SPANISH style" but really it was sautéed snails with spinach and truffle oil & balsamic vinaigrette, the most amazing appetizer that I've ever had....probably in my life. We also had the Beef Tartare - superb - absolutely a delicious start to our meal.Then for our entrees we ordered the Duck Confit, Flank Steak & the Lamb Shank in Whiskey BBQ sauce. ALL 3 were absolutely amazingly delicious but the Lamb Shank wins the competition! Mind blowing sauce and the tender lamb fell off the bone just by touching it.All around - one of the most amazing meals that we had in Montreal - highly recommend!!!!!

Super nice place, excellent french onion soup, delicious authentic Montreal crepes. And in a nice, interesting neighborhood. In fact, after lunch we hiked from the restaurant to the top of Mount Royal! Great way to spend the afternoon.
Very cute restaurant.  The menu was not very broad and the food was average for the price.   We enjoyed the experience and it was a great location.
